metadata.name: DIP
metadata.description:
In this months edition, which coincides with Pride Month, I continue to commemorate the significance of male erotica photography. In the photograph "DIP," I return to explore the profound beauty of water that has always captivated me.

The pool, becomes a powerful metaphor for a journey towards renewal. The interplay of light and shadow adds an enigmatic quality, reminiscent of the mesmerizing pool paintings created by the renowned queer artist David Hockney.

The model, with his fixed gaze, leaves us pondering what captures his attention. It is through these moments that I aim to celebrate the diversity of desire and the exploration of male sensuality, inviting viewers to delve into the complexities of their own desires.

With the release of this edition during Pride Month, I hope "DIP" transports viewers into a world submerged with emotions, evoking a sense of unity, acceptance, and celebration of all forms of love and desire.

1996 The Pine Fire Island NY
